p: The workflow diagram of our study was presented in Figure 1. The mean ribose nucleic acid (RNA) expressions of BDNF in 157 HD cases (-0.12 ± 0.20) were significantly lower than that of 157 non-dementia controls (0.16 ± 0.23; P < 0.001) ( Figure 2A). After the removal of repetitive and unannotated genes, 19,414 background genes were included for differentially expressed genes (DEGs) analysis. Significant changes in the expression of 2,294 genes (1,221 up-regulated and 1,037 down-regulated) were identified in HD versus non-dementia controls ( Figure 2B); whilst 2,173 DEGs (1,028 up-regulated and 1,145 down-regulated) were determined in BDNF-low versus high group ( Figure 2C). Thereafter, 1,675 overlapping DEGs were included between HD / control and BDNF-low / high cohorts. Heatmap of cluster analysis showed that the expression of the top 25 down-regulated and up-regulated DEGs distinguished HD from control samples ( Figure 2D).
